name: Resonance
headline: Universal Add-On For Marketing Content Personalization
description: Resonance enables companies to personalize omni-channel marketing campaign content within their existing tools with minimal to no engineering involvement.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:reinforcement-learning; industry:saas; industry:subscriptions; industry:marketing; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Jonathan Ou, Founder
founders.description: Jonathan is the CEO of Resonance. Before Resonance, he worked at DoorDash on a voice AI to automatically place customer orders over the phone. Prior to DoorDash, he worked at Dropbox to help build an internal in-product messaging platform that generated $100 million ARR. Prior to Dropbox, he worked at Microsoft helping build a platform that enabled doctors and patients to meet virtually using Microsoft Teams.

generated_description:
Resonance, founded in 2023 and presently part of Y Combinator's W24 batch, is a San Francisco-based startup aimed at revolutionizing the way companies personalize their marketing content. With a compact team of just two, the company’s mission is to create a universal add-on for marketing content personalization. Their innovative approach allows businesses to seamlessly personalize their omni-channel marketing campaigns within existing tools—requiring minimal engineering effort.

Resonance's platform leverages artificial intelligence and reinforcement learning to facilitate content customization in a way that feels native to the tools marketers already use. Whether through Pendo, Appcues, Iterable, or Customer.io, Resonance promises to enhance the user experience by delivering tailored messaging across numerous platforms, from email campaigns to push notifications.

With Harj Taggar as their group partner, Resonance offers a compelling service in the crowded SaaS marketplace, directly addressing the growing demand for personalized marketing in a world saturated with generic communications. Not nestled in some tech incubator, but right in the heart of the San Francisco Bay Area, they’re making strides to ensure marketers can craft messages that resonate—pun entirely intended.

Curious about how it all works? They encourage potential users to book a demo through their website at [useresonance.com](https://www.useresonance.com/). It’s simple: the future of personalized marketing might just hinge on how well you can leverage what Resonance is creating.
